meanings.definition: In a way that is openly and obviously offensive or scandalous.
meanings.sent1: She flagrantly ignored the rules and got in trouble.
meanings.sent2: The celebrity was caught flagrantly breaking the law.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel flagrantly stole all the nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The politician flagrantly lied to the public during the debate.
meanings.sent5: The student was flagrantly cheating on the exam, right in front of the teacher.

meanings.definition: In a way that is blatantly or conspicuously evident.
meanings.sent1: The bright red car flagrantly stood out among the sea of black vehicles.
meanings.sent2: The error in the report was flagrantly obvious to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The cat flagrantly knocked over the vase, then looked innocent.
meanings.sent4: The smell of freshly baked cookies flagrantly filled the entire house.
meanings.sent5: The neon sign flagrantly glowed in the dark, attracting customers from afar.
